meanings.definition: Take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: The new technology will supercede the old one in our office.
meanings.sent2: The young prince will supercede his father as the king one day.
meanings.sent3: The robot thought it could supercede the human workers, but they all became friends instead.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun seemed to supercede the darkness of the night, bringing hope to the land.
meanings.sent5: The idea of peace should supercede all conflicts and disagreements.

meanings.definition: Replace (someone or something) in a position of power or authority
meanings.sent1: The new manager will supercede the current one next month.
meanings.sent2: The elected president will supercede the previous leader in the country.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to supercede the dog as the ruler of the house, but they ended up sharing the throne.
meanings.sent4: The bright star seemed to supercede all others in the night sky, shining the brightest.
meanings.sent5: The hero's courage will supercede any fear in the face of danger.
